title: rustc and rustdoc manpages are out of sync in the installer
body:
Installed rust as per the [download](https://www.rust-lang.org/en-US/downloads.html) page:

```
curl -sSf https://static.rust-lang.org/rustup.sh | sh
```

The installed manpages for `rustc` and `rustdoc` appear to be those for rust 1.2.0 instead of the installed version, i.e. rust 1.11.0

``` sh
$ rustc --version
rustc 1.11.0 (9b21dcd6a 2016-08-15)
$ head /usr/local/share/man/man1/rustc.1 
.TH RUSTC "1" "August 2015" "rustc 1.2.0" "User Commands"
.SH NAME
rustc \- The Rust compiler
.SH SYNOPSIS
.B rustc
[\fIOPTIONS\fR] \fIINPUT\fR

.SH DESCRIPTION
This program is a compiler for the Rust language, available at https://www.rust\-lang.org.

$ head /usr/local/share/man/man1/rustdoc.1 
.TH RUSTDOC "1" "August 2015" "rustdoc 1.2.0" "User Commands"
.SH NAME
rustdoc \- generate documentation from Rust source code
.SH SYNOPSIS
.B rustdoc
[\fIOPTIONS\fR] \fIINPUT\fR

.SH DESCRIPTION
This tool generates API reference documentation by extracting comments from
source code written in the Rust language, available at
```

This appears to be coming from the tarball itself:

``` sh
$ tar zxvf rust-1.11.0-i686-unknown-linux-gnu.tar.gz -O **/rustc.1 | head
.TH RUSTC "1" "August 2015" "rustc 1.2.0" "User Commands"
.SH NAME
rustc \- The Rust compiler
.SH SYNOPSIS
.B rustc
[\fIOPTIONS\fR] \fIINPUT\fR

.SH DESCRIPTION
This program is a compiler for the Rust language, available at https://www.rust\-lang.org.
```
